headline.print_headline: Romney Is Upbeat, But Math Is the Same
headline.seo: Romney Campaign Fights for Electoral Votes
headline.main: Romney Is Upbeat, but Math Is the Same

docs.snippet: Mitt Romney is savoring the new energy around his candidacy and dwelling less on the main obstacle ahead: the Electoral College....
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney, while savoring newfound enthusiasm surrounding his campaign and speaking with increasing confidence about his ability to overtake Pres Obama, still faces  daunting challenge in taking the Electoral College; feat will require that he either wins  Ohio or performs almost flawlessly in every other battleground state.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Jeff Zeleny reported from Columbus, Ohio, and Ashley Parker from Reno, Nev.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is savoring the new energy around his candidacy and dwelling less on the main obstacle ahead: the Electoral College.

headline.print_headline: Parliament Questions Former BBC Chief’s Role
headline.seo: British Lawmakers Question Ex-BBC Chief’s Role
headline.main: British Parliament Questions Former BBC Chief’s Role

docs.snippet: As the investigation into the BBC’s handling of Jimmy Savile continues, the actions of its former director general, Mark Thompson, are coming under increased scrutiny....
docs.abstract: Actions of former BBC director general Mark Thompson are coming under increased scrutiny as investigation into handling of Jimmy Savile sex abuse scandal continues.

byline.original: By MATTHEW PURDY and CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY
byline.contributor: Matthew Purdy reported from London, and Christine Haughney from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the investigation into the BBC’s handling of Jimmy Savile continues, the actions of its former director general, Mark Thompson, are coming under increased scrutiny.

headline.print_headline: Whooping Cough Vaccine Urged For Pregnant Women
headline.main: Whooping Cough Vaccine Urged for Pregnant Women

docs.snippet: The advice, for women in their third trimester, follows a resurgence of the disease and is only the second time a vaccine has been advised for all women during pregnancy....
docs.abstract: Government’s vaccine advisory panel is urging every expectant mother to get whooping cough vaccine, preferably in last three months of pregnancy, following resurgence of the disease.
docs.lead_paragraph: The advice, for women in their third trimester, follows a resurgence of the disease and is only the second time a vaccine has been advised for all women during pregnancy.

headline.print_headline: A Team by Any Other Name May Be Less Confusing
headline.seo: ‘Brooklyn Islanders’ Is Geographically Correct, If Confusing
headline.main: A Team by Any Other Name May Be Less Confusing

docs.snippet: Some fans would prefer to rename the Brooklyn-bound Islanders, but finding a suitable alternative is a tough task....
docs.abstract: Some NHL fans would prefer to rename the Brooklyn-bound New York Islanders, but finding a suitable alternative is a tough task.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some fans would prefer to rename the Brooklyn-bound Islanders, but finding a suitable alternative is a tough task.

headline.seo: The Campaign Money Trail in Illinois

docs.snippet: The ugly campaign between Joe Walsh and Tammy Duckworth stands out for its saturating quantities of rancor, negativity and free-flowing cash....
docs.abstract: Editorial asserts election for Illinois's Eighth Congressional District seat is prime example of how Citizens United decision has allowed unlimited sums of outside money to taint elections; observes that contest between incumbent Republican Rep Joe Walsh and Democratic candidate Tammy Duckworth is one of ugliest campaigns in country.
docs.lead_paragraph: The ugly campaign between Joe Walsh and Tammy Duckworth stands out for its saturating quantities of rancor, negativity and free-flowing cash.

docs.snippet: The F.D.R. memorial is a stirring tribute to a leader whose ideas of freedom remain relevant well beyond his time....
docs.abstract: Editorial praises newly opened Franklin Delano Roosevelt memorial on Roosevelt Island; contends it is stirring tribute to leader whose ideas of freedom remain relevant well beyond his time.
docs.lead_paragraph: The F.D.R. memorial is a stirring tribute to a leader whose ideas of freedom remain relevant well beyond his time.

docs.snippet: Loan modification programs are needed for distressed borrowers with private student loans....
docs.abstract: Editorial contends annual report issued by Consumer Financial Protection Bureau's student loan ombudsman underlines need for loan modification programs for distressed borrowers with private student loans; calls for standards that will help protect borrowers from slipshod loan servicing that increases likelihood they will fall behind in payments.
docs.lead_paragraph: Loan modification programs are needed for distressed borrowers with private student loans.

docs.snippet: If you want to see how Romney-endorsed austerity measures would work out here, just look at Europe. And weep....
docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column predicts that state of European economies should give pause to those who believe austerity measures are answer to US economic woes; underlines similarities between Mitt Romney's proposed austerity measures and those enacted in Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: If you want to see how Romney-endorsed austerity measures would work out here, just look at Europe. And weep.

docs.snippet: A mere $77 million later, Linda McMahon is still trying to get elected to the United States Senate....
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column analyzes contest between Democratic Rep Chris Murphy and Republican candidate Linda McMahon for Connecticut's open United States Senate seat; observes that to date McMahon has spent more than $77 million trying to get elected to Senate, and has largely focused on negative campaigning.
docs.lead_paragraph: A mere $77 million later, Linda McMahon is still trying to get elected to the United States Senate.

headline.print_headline: Betty Binns Fletcher, Liberal Stalwart on Bench, Dies at 89
headline.seo: Betty Binns Fletcher, Liberal Federal Judge, Dies at 89
headline.main: Betty Binns Fletcher Dies at 89; Liberal Stalwart on the Bench

docs.snippet: Judge Fletcher generally wrote liberal opinions on matters like employment discrimination, environmental protection and the death penalty...
docs.abstract: Betty Binns Fletcher, federal appeals court judge with liberal record, dies at age 89.
docs.lead_paragraph: Judge Fletcher generally wrote liberal opinions on matters like employment discrimination, environmental protection and the death penalty
